smell_analysis.justification: All pages in the provided PDF contain visual diagrams or model element lists; no empty diagrams were found.

All use cases are associated with actors, either directly or via inclusion/extension from other use cases that are connected to actors (e.g., 'Vaata kõiki ootel...' is included by 'Aktiveeri auto', which connects to 'Autode haldur').
No use cases with synonymous names describing the same activity were found for the same actor. Names like 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid' and 'Vaata kõiki autosid' denote distinct functionalities.
No duplicate model element names were found within the same package scope.

No redundant data value storage without foreign keys was identified. Common column names like 'nimetus' appear in different tables (Riik, Auto_mark) but represent distinct attributes of those entities, which is allowed.
Use case naming is consistent, using the imperative verb form in Estonian (e.g., 'Vaata...', 'Tuvasta...', 'Registreeri...', 'Muuda...').
In the state diagram 'Auto seisundidiagramm' (Page 9), all states (including final states like 'Unustatud' and 'Lõpetatud') are reachable via transitions from the start node.
In the activity diagram 'Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm' (Page 4), all actions and decisions are reachable from the start node.
Relationships in the class diagrams (e.g., Pages 10, 11) properly display multiplicity indicators (e.g., 1, 0..*) at the ends of associations.
No single diagram contains 10 or more central elements. The densest diagram (Page 14) contains 9 tables.

On the class diagram 'Autode register' (Page 11), the class 'Auto' has 6 visual connection lines to other classes: 'Auto_mark', 'Auto_kütuse_liik', 'Auto_seisundi_liik', 'Auto_kategooria_omamine', and two separate associations to 'Töötaja' (for roles 'registreerija' and 'viimane muutja').
The layout of the diagrams is generally uniform, with no related elements placed excessively far apart compared to the average distance.
All use case names and activity diagram actions start with active/imperative verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Vali').
No class, table, attribute, or use case names were found to be 3 characters or less. (Note: 'id' is used as a stereotype/property, not the attribute name itself).
Class names (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Klient') start with uppercase letters and are singular.
Attribute and column names (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'nimetus', 'kood') consistently start with lowercase letters.

No type prefixes (Hungarian notation) were found on attributes or class names. Prefixes like 'PK_', 'FK_', 'IXFK_', and 'AK_' found in the model denote keys/constraints, which are allowed or analogous to the allowed exceptions.
